35232142: Flooding in Dumfries and Galloway and the Scottish Borders has caused widespread damage, with repair work ongoing and a flood alert remaining in place due to constant rain.
40143035: A fire deliberately started under two tour buses parked at a Northern Ireland hotel destroyed the vehicles and their passengers' belongings.
35951548: Mercedes' Lewis Hamilton secured pole position for the Bahrain Grand Prix, edging out teammate Nico Rosberg by 0.077 seconds in a closely contested qualifying session.
36266422: A 67-year-old former scout leader in Lincolnshire faces 22 charges, including indecency with a child, after four male complainants alleged sexual abuse between 1972 and 1989.
38826984: A man receiving psychiatric treatment at a Turkish hospital threatened to shoot himself and others, prompting an evacuation and police negotiation.
34540833: Glasgow Warriors secured a narrow 20-17 win over the Dragons, with Simone Favaro scoring the decisive try in the final minutes of the game.
20836172: A 31-year-old woman was killed and another man injured when an Audi A3 struck them in Streatham, London, with police searching for a 27-year-old man linked to the vehicle.
35932467: Belgian cyclist Antoine Demoitie, 25, died after a collision with a motorbike during the Gent-Wevelgem race, prompting calls for improved safety measures in professional cycling.
40758845: Ilkay Gundogan is recovering from a knee injury and expects to return to the pitch in "weeks" rather than months, with City set to face Tottenham in their final US tour match.
30358490: A man in his 20s was seriously injured in a car crash on the A127 in Essex, treated at the scene and airlifted to the Royal London Hospital for further treatment.
34615665: A tropical storm in Mexico has reached category 5, the highest rating, for the first time since 1959, according to reports.
35890902: Researchers from Bastille Networks found vulnerabilities in wireless mice that allowed attackers to spoof signals and take control of computers using a $20 kit and a few lines of code.
37922330: Administrators confirmed 38 redundancies at Galashiels-based Murray and Burrell due to adverse trading conditions, with some workers potentially finding new jobs in nearby Melrose.
30844962: The European Commission has expressed doubts about a 2003 tax deal between Luxembourg and Amazon, citing potential state aid and tax avoidance.
36217333: The Balmoral Show, a three-day agricultural event, celebrates farming, food, and family fun with local produce, livestock, and entertainment for visitors in Northern Ireland.
30816523: Google is being sued by Max Mosley for allegedly breaching the Data Protection Act by hosting photos of a private sex party on its search engine.
38900884: Dragons forward Taulupe Faletau will be a significant loss for the team after suffering an injury, but others are expected to step up in his place.
13890581: A three-year funding package has been secured for the Cornish Language Partnership, ensuring the language's survival and paving the way for long-term support from Cornwall.
40194700: AS Monaco manager Leonardo Jardim has signed a new contract, describing his time at the club as "exceptional" after their 2016-17 Ligue 1 championship win.
37903647: The Nicaraguan government's election process has been deemed flawed by the US State Department, citing opposition candidate suppression and lack of international observers.
13291223: South African authorities have agreed to classify "corrective rape" as a hate crime after 170,000 activists worldwide demanded action to protect lesbians targeted for the brutal attacks.
36052570: Global oil production levels and US stocks fell amid concerns over oversupply and weak economic indicators, including a decline in US industrial production.
34944735: A study by US biologists found that the vibrant blue color in tarantulas evolved independently at least eight times, suggesting it serves an important visual signaling function.
32159602: German prosecutors found internet searches on co-pilot Andreas Lubitz's tablet for ways to commit suicide and cockpit security, supporting evidence he intentionally crashed Flight 9525.
34988915: A 54-year-old former radio DJ denies eight counts of indecent assault and two counts of sexual assault, claiming his past "horseplay" with colleagues was consensual.
37889203: Tottenham's Dele Alli will be out for a few weeks after twisting his knee in a clash with a team-mate during training.
33609927: A Jehovah's Witnesses elder, Mark Sewell, was convicted of sexually abusing his niece and a family friend, despite the organisation's in-house policy of requiring two witnesses to report abuse.
33578778: Greece's former finance minister Yanis Varoufakis predicts the country's bailout program will fail, calling it the "greatest disaster of macroeconomic management ever".
